public abstract class zeta.form.TopLevelForm

(source file: TopLevelForm.pizza)

   +----zeta.form.Form

           +----zeta.form.CompoundForm

                   +----zeta.form.TopLevelForm
The pure class interface. 
public abstract class TopLevelForm
  extends CompoundForm
The class of top-level forms.

A top-level form represents an interaction which can be registered at the session system to be made available to the user.

Author:
Wolfgang Grieskamp (wg@cs.tu-berlin.de)
Version: $Id: TopLevelForm.pizza,v 1.4 2000/05/14 17:43:32 wg Exp $

TopLevelForm(Style, Form, String)
Construct a top-level form.

longDescr
The long description of this top-level form.
style
The style of this top-level form, if handled by a GUI.
subform
The form associated with this top-level form.

Get the sub-forms.

Get syntax description

Make a top-level form, where setup and action are given as Pizza functions.

The long description of this top-level form.

setup
public void setup(Session session);
A method which is called before the form is evaluated. May be overwritten in order to initialize state variables.

perform

public abstract void perform(Session session,
                             Locator locator)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.FormFailed;
A method representing the action associated with this top-level form. Passed is the session under which the form is evaluated.

                                Form subform,

Make a top-level form, where the action is given as a Pizza function.

                                Form subform,

                                (Session) -> void setupFun,

Make a top-level form, where setup and action are given as Pizza functions.

parse

public int parse(Session session,
                 Locator locator,
                 String[] words,
                 int start)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.FormFailed;
Parse the given sequence of words starting at index. By default, this parses the subform and performs the action on success.
